title: New: Silence Dogood – Paradise City / Wonder Years
content:
I’m not quite sure why I’m so in love with Silence Dogood.

Their sound is a bizarre hybrid of 90’s scuzzy grunge and mid-00’s pop, yet somehow it works perfectly. With recent EP The Sound Of Silence proving one of my favourite releases of 2012 thus far, and new two track single Detox further building on their disjointed, angst driven attitude. Penning lyrics with an insight that only disillusioned adolescents can do – “And the nightlife is great / But all of the drinks taste like rape / Drunken muscle-head fights / College kids are always right”, it’s 50% tongue in cheek, 50% a kick in the balls to big business controlled capitalism, and it’s never sounded so good.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
